file_content.text: Keep breathing.
You're a stubborn one, I'll give you that. How're you feeling? Tired of bleeding yet?
I'm not entering the Great Hunt for the consolation prize.
I came to win.
Nobody does. Remember that.
Try not to lose that enthusiasm. It'll drive the competition up a wall.
I'm going to take a beating, I get it.
You made your point.
Lesson learned.
Thanks for the lesson.
It's been a pleasure.
My pleasure.
He's a ferocious, little son of a gundark who heard the best defense was a good offense and ran with it.
Take what he says in moderation.
You must be the one the rally master called about.
Hmm. Decent gear for running Hutt errands, but it won't get you far in the Great Hunt.
What's wrong with my equipment?
Is it that bad?
Durasteel's all well and good, but keeping your guts on the inside is a job for Mandalorian iron.
It's been doing the job so far.
I look worried to you?
Take pride in your equipment, but don't forget its limits. Or yours.
Your armor should be a second skin--more comfortable than a warm bed.
But thick, heavy plating takes practice and endurance to move in.
There's no room for dabbling.
Makes sense.
Exactly. Strapping on a reinforced suit without the chops for it is as good as painting a target on yourself.
I'm not afraid of a little workout.
I can handle it.
Working a sweat's the easy part. It's the blood and tears you should worry about.
Any other obvious advice you want to pass on?
I don't need basic training.
Time to appreciate solid defensive tactics--and pain, which you'll have a lot of without them.
Kindly sniff around elsewhere.
You're a natural with heavy ordnance. Head back to the rally master and get yourself loaded up to win the Great Hunt.
I'd best not keep Kelborn waiting.
I'll do that.
If it isn't already over.
Finally!
Don't be a poor sport.
I'll be rooting.
Nice blaster, it's a start. So what do you do with your free hand? Fix your hair, strike a pose, or is your aim so shaky you need two?
I assume you've got a better idea.
I can take a hint.
I'm gonna go with option two.
Sure, something like that.
Gonna take out the competition with glib remarks?
I save it for loudmouths giving me lip.
Don't start with me.
Ha! Good answer, but you missed the point.
An empty hand's wasted potential. Better off holding another weapon.
The Great Hunt ain't scoring on neatness; it's kill or be killed. Better be ready to bring all you got when the time comes.
I'll start practicing with my off-hand.
Noted.
A good pair of blasters can handle just about anything. For what they can't, there's high-yield explosives.
I plan to do all the killing.
Don't worry about me.
Then keep up on the latest weapon tech and don't be afraid to use it.
I prefer to make my shots count.
That's just sloppy.
Finesse is for show-offs and snipers, guess we know which one you are.
Why don't you show me what I need to improve?
I'm open to suggestions.
Give us a good show.
Not one bit.
